H0.text: An insect that lives and feeds on the body of an alligator is a mutualistic relationship.

H1.text: An ant that lives on a plant and defends the plant from other insects is a mutualistic relationship.

H2.text: A bird that migrates to follow the movements of the butterflies that it eats is a mutualistic relationship.

H3.text: A deer that eats one kind of plant, which allows another kind of plant to grow in its place, is a mutualistic relationship.

A4.text: Mutualism (biology) refers to positive interactions between species.
